title: Typophile is REALLY S-L-O-W today
content:
Is it just my eyes or is this everyone else as well? Every other site I visit is as snappy as usual.

ChrisL

 [‹ more font awareness](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143829/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43315 "Go to previous forum topic") [HP LaserJets: 1022 vs P2015? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143829/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43397 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dezcom

comments.content: She’s moving at a rather glacial pace.

Can tell you this much, Chris: it’s no Swiss picnic getting pages to load from Athens either. Must be a traffic jam or three on the “information superhighway” (god-awful metaphor that it is). Άντε γειά for now.
With me t-o-o Chris. It seems that when the n-u-m-b-e-r of those log on is around 250 and up, Typophile moves s-l-o-w-e-r (?)
My guess is that the punchcut guys are hogging the bandwidth playing Guitar Hero on Xbox live.

Whatever the cause, at times it’s downright sluggish.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143829im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/sluggish_4300.png)

<cite>My guess is that the punchcut guys are hogging the bandwidth playing Guitar Hero on Xbox live.</cite>

They’re a bunch of UI design nerds, so it’s probably Rock Band. Guitar Hero is SO 2006.
It was slow earlier today. But seems fine now.
Try playing scrabulous on Facebook if you want slow. I call it Scrabu-lag but nobody is doing their work right now.

\>Guitar Hero is SO 2006.

2007!

[http://flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/1188302731/in/photostream/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012143829/http:/flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/1188302731/in/photostream/ "http://flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/1188302731/in/photostream/")

You could all use the opportunity to get back to work!

Or maybe that’s just me....

OK, Haley, I’ll go back to being retired :-)

ChrisL

“Άντε γειά”

:-)

The “Super Highways” cars drive on around here near Washington, DC move at the “Slug Pace” Ernie Kovacs pictured above so why would we expect the Ether variety to move any better:-)

At any rate, my greetings to you in Greece. I would wish you god-speed but that might not be any faster than what we have.

ChrisL

Actually, Tiff, it is a bit faster now. Maybe Joe and Jared put down their game toys and went back to scateboarding :-)

“Where is my insignia?”. I spent too much time here this past week. I get to go...

Cheers - “Don’t get to excited on spring”...

<cite>My guess is that the punchcut guys are hogging the bandwidth playing Guitar Hero on Xbox live.</cite>

<cite>They’re a bunch of UI design nerds, so it’s probably Rock Band. Guitar Hero is SO 2006.</cite>

Do you guys have spies in our office or something? The fact of the matter is, we are busy preparing for a Rock Band tournament, being held this evening in our new pad. Seriously - we’ll have pictures to prove it.

I don’t know why the site was slow, but typically in the morning hours (for PST) is our busiest time. We’ll take a look and ensure everything is running smoothly on the back end.

\>we’ll have pictures to prove it.

How about video. Just no spandex, okay? ;-)

Zara, you guys are having way too much fun out there!

ChrisL

“We’ll take a look and ensure everything is running smoothly on the back end.”

I was going to make a dirty insinuation, but...
The internet tubes need flushing!

“The internet tubes need flushing!”

If they have been getting all that colon cleansing spam that is floating around, they will know how to do it :-)

ChrisL

<cite>The fact of the matter is, we are busy preparing for a Rock Band tournament, being held this evening in our new pad.</cite>

See! They were downloading all the new Rock Band tracks!
